sentence.Network_en: The treaties renounce the use of force and pledge the two countries to co-operation.

jx.jx_en_mean: completely withdraw from society or material affairs in order to lead a life considered to be more spiritually fulfilling

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French renoncer, from Latin renuntiare 'protest against', from re- (expressing reversal) + nuntiare 'announce'

entry.tran: 宣布放弃，抛弃(信仰或行为方式)
entry.def: If you renounce a belief or a way of behaving, you decide and declare publicly that you no longer have that belief or will no longer behave in that way.

example.ex: After a period of imprisonment she renounced terrorism...
example.tran: 在被囚禁一段时间之后，她宣布放弃恐怖主义。

entry.tran: 正式放弃(要求、官阶或头衔)
entry.def: If you renounce a claim, rank, or title, you officially give it up.

example.ex: He renounced his claim to the French throne.
example.tran: 他正式放弃对法国王位的继承权。

means.word_mean: 1. give up, such as power, as of monarchs and emperors, or duties and obligations;

sentences.sentence: "The King abdicated when he married a divorcee"

means.word_mean: 2. leave (a job, post, post, or position) voluntarily;

sentences.sentence: "She vacated the position when she got pregnant"
"The chairman resigned when he was found to have misappropriated funds"

stems_affixes.word_buile: announce[v.通告]+ment表名词→n.布告,通告;声明,预告
an一再+nounce通知→一再通知→通告

stems_affixes.value_cn: 公开指责,公然抨击;谴责
stems_affixes.word_buile: de坏+nounce讲话,说出→讲坏话→抨击

pro在前+nounce讲话,说出→在[嘴]前讲话→发音
re反+nounce讲话,说出→反过来说→否认

sentences.en: Andrew renounced his claim to the property.
sentences.cn: 安德鲁放弃了财产的所有权。

sentences.en: We have renounced the use of force to settle our disputes.
sentences.cn: 我们已再次宣布放弃使用武力来解决争端。
